many newspapers who endorsed G.W. in 2000. :)  I see international
travel prices going through the roof if this doesn't come through.

(And it looks like I beat the 4am. deadline too! Oh, I hope Osby found a
crash space.  I didn't hear any doorbell ring nor knock.)

P.S., If you're wondering about how you can help out with this thing
even if you're in Cali, email me and I can try to point you in the right
direction.)


http://www.yesbushcan.com/media.shtml

October 27, 2004
  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Contact
  Website: http://www.yesbushcan.com/
  Act: http://www.yesbushcan.com/act.shtml

BUSH CAMPAIGN GROUP ENDORSES KERRY

"Yes, Bush Can" now says "no, Bush can't!"

Yes, Bush Can, an independent group dedicated to communicating Bush
policies directly to the public, has abandoned its campaign and is
officially endorsing John Kerry for President.

Before changing sides, the Yes, Bush Can team drove around the
country supporting the President in a campaign bus equipped with
sound and light systems, confetti cannons, and various props and
costumes. They gave dozens of stump speeches, distributed campaign
videos and "USA Patriot Pledges," and performed patriotic songs to
audiences across the country. (See
http://www.yesbushcan.com/media.shtml and
http://www.yesbushcan.com/pledge.shtml.)

Last week, the group officially split with Bush. "In the course of
our travels, we ended up learning more about Bush's policies than he
wanted us to know," said Harmon Spellmeyer, one of the Yes, Bush Can
team. "We came to see that this administration is a catastrophe for
most people."

Before breaking with Bush, the Yes, Bush Can team worked earnestly to
support him. They went to the Pacific Northwest to promote Bush's
Healthy Forests Initiative--and discovered it was enabling the
logging industry to cut down our last old-growth forests. They
visited a nuclear power plant in Ohio to promote Bush's domestic
security policies--and found no one in the guard booth to meet them.
In western Pennsylvania, while promoting the President's energy
policy, they learned that it allows coal emissions which kill 23,000
people a year. Finally, while defending Bush's war on terrorism, they
found out that most analysts--including Donald Rumsfeld and many
generals--feel that the Iraq War has actually generated many
thousands of new terrorists.

After many similar discoveries and much internal turmoil, the Yes,
Bush Can group arrived at the difficult conclusion that they could
not continue their work. At a press conference Tuesday, the team
defaced and abandoned their campaign bus in order to demonstrate how
profoundly they are rejecting their former boss's ideas and policies.

 From now until the election, the former Bush campaigners will be
doing all they can to make sure that Bush is prevented from winning
the presidency. They will be joining many thousands of others in
going door-to-door to "get out the vote" in cities throughout
Florida--beginning with Jacksonville, a mostly Black city where
11,000 votes were never counted in 2000. (Statewide, 179,000 votes
weren't counted, more than half of them Black. 90% of Blacks voted
for Gore.)

The former Yes, Bush Can team recommends the following websites to
those who wish to help "get out the vote":

http://acthere.com/
http://drivingvotes.org/
http://www.democrats.org/roadtrip/
http://volunteer.johnkerry.com/traveler/
http://www.moveonpac.org/lnvb/travel/
http://www.aflcio.org/issuespolitics/politics/volunteernow.cfm

To canvas by phone, visit http://www.partyforamerica.org/phone/ or
http://calls.johnkerry.com/.

Send a "vote" eCard at
http://www.aflcio.org/familyfunresources/ecards/. To offer financial
support to "get out the vote" efforts, visit
http://acthere.com/gotv-contribute/ or
https://www.democrats.org/support/.

Finally, visit the Yes, Bush Can website to follow the Yes, Bush Can
team as they join thousands of others in helping make sure that Bush
can do no more damage to America's economy, ecology, and dignity.


http://www.jcthedj.com
AIM: jckzsu (or kzsudj during my show.)

-- 
When you've got a major artery gushing blood you don't try to
reconstruct the entire area right then. You put a tourniquet on it.
John Kerry is that tourniquet.

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

the employees aren't that careful, either.

throughout the weekend, month, year... all of that cost is passed along
to you in your drink prices & door charges.

Subject: [sfraves] (NRR)  TOTAL LUNAR ECLIPSE on October 27

--0-1197578883-1098898615=:24132
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Thought this might interest you...
 
love, Heidi

Borealis2000 Newsletter <dirkobudzinski@borealis2000.com> wrote:

Borealis2000News
Total Lunar Eclipse

The second and last lunar eclipse of the year will be well placed for North Americans. Totality lasts 1 hour 21 minutes while the Moon will glow in yellow-orange and coppery-red colors. The totally eclipsed Moon will appear to have a bright rim along its northern edge. 
 


OBSERVING TIMES
US and Canada: The Moon enters Earth's shadow at 9:14 pm EST / (6:14 pm PST), followed by totality during 10:23 - 11:45 pm EST / 7:23 - 8:45 pm PST and exits Earth's shadow at 00:54 am EST / 9:54 pm PST.

Europe: Eclipse occurs during the early morning hours of Thursday, October 28. The Moon enters Earth's shadow at 01:14 UTC, followed by totality during 02:23 - 03:45 UTC and exits Earth's shadow at 04:54 UTC.
 
 
Clear skies and enjoy the show!

Dirk Obudzinski
http://borealis2000.com






--0-1197578883-1098898615=:24132--

Wed. Oct. 27th: S??perQo?l vs Sister


Qo?l has invited us down for another head-to-head session! 

With: Forest Green, Seraphim, Samira, and residents Spesh, Mark Musselman,
Scott Carrelli, and Jerry Bonham. 

It starts at 5pm, so, make an executive decision & leave work early! 

111 Minna, SF, 5-11pm, $5, 21+ 

==================================== 

Step right up and toss down five bones for your chance to witness another
epic battle of the sexes. The ultra-slick residents of Qo?l welcome the
Sister SF super vixens to the arena of 111 Minna for another record-slinging
showdown. This is some serious turntable talent, and the last time these two
crews got together every ass in the house was helpless before the onslaught
of their combined grooves.

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 27 Oct 2004 19:03:01.0265 (UTC) FILETIME=[947D9010:01C4BC57]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] MIX REVIEW: Koroma Live on House Nation

Ok, so Koroma gave me this like 3 months ago (maybe more), and I am just now 
peeping it as I sit here at my lovely new job (which allows me the luxury of 
jamming beats all day long whilst I work).

I have to say, barring a few sloppy mixes - this mix SLAYS. Definitely your 
mama's sleepy ass progressive house. This mix bangs like crazy, has an 
overall excellent track selection/programming and really gets you amped up. 
I am bouncing in my seat as I listen to it, and I'm quite sure my co-workers 
think I'm ADHD or crackhead - somethin' along those lines.

Anyhoo - I don't have a tracklisting, but rest assured, it is dope.

While we're BS'ing about prog.house - go to  www.friskyradio.com  and 
download Jack Triumph's latest mix "Feel". It is 
realllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllly pretty, well executed, and epic. As 
good if not better than those shite Global Underground mixes put out by the 
"pros". (and Jack actually mixes - no digital mixing)

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Substructure//Mario Bros.
DC/MD/VA/CA
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
AIM:  OPKing138

Upcoming dates:
10-29-04 @ SUEDE (San Francisco, CA)

Play It Again, Sam
John Kerry named Sam Rodriguez his new WA state dir. Rodriguez said the
Dem ticket is "a perfect match" for the "trade-dependent state, despite"
GOP criticism of John Edwards' "protectionist views." Rodriguez said
he's "guardedly optimistic" that Kerry and Edwards will carry WA's 11
EVs, noting that "the high caliber" of Sen. Patty Murray's (D)
reelection campaign "will lift all Democratic candidates." Rodriguez
said the Spokane media market "is a key target"; the region "narrowly
went for" Pres. Clinton, but Pres. Bush "trounced" Al Gore in 2000.
Rodriguez: "We feel good about breaking even or winning there this time"
(Ammons, AP, 7/10).

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  'Hobbit' joins human family tree

--=====================_13859368==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

  'Hobbit' joins human family tree
BBC News

Scientists have discovered a new and tiny species of human that lived in 
Indonesia at the same time our own ancestors were colonising the world.

The three-foot (one-metre) tall species - dubbed "the Hobbit" - lived on 
Flores island until at least 12,000 years ago.

The fact that little people feature in the legends of modern Flores 
islanders suggests we might have to take tales of Leprechauns and Yeti more 
seriously.

Details of the sensational find are described in the journal Nature.

The discovery has been hailed as one of the most significant of its type in 
decades.

Australian archaeologists unearthed the bones while digging at a site 
called Liang Bua, one of numerous limestone caves on Flores.

The remains of the partial skeleton were found at a depth of 5.9m. At 
first, the researchers thought it was the body of a child. But further 
investigation revealed otherwise.

Wear on the teeth and growth lines on the skull confirm it was an adult, 
features of the pelvis identify it as female and a leg bone confirms that 
it walked upright like we do.

"When we got the dates back from the skeleton and we found out how young it 
was, one anthropologist working with us said it must be wrong because it 
had so many archaic [primitive] traits," said co-discoverer Mike Morwood, 
associate professor of archaeology at the University of New England, Australia.

King of the swingers?

The 18,000-year-old specimen, known as Liang Bua 1 or LB1, has been 
assigned to a new species called Homo floresiensis . It was about one metre 
tall with long arms and a skull the size of a large grapefruit.

The researchers have since found remains belonging to six other individuals 
from the same species.

LB1 shared its island with a golden retriever-sized rat, giant tortoises 
and huge lizards - including Komodo dragons - and a pony-sized dwarf 
elephant called Stegodon which the "hobbits" probably hunted.

Chris Stringer, head of human origins at London's Natural History Museum 
said the long arms were an intriguing feature and might even suggest H. 
floresiensis spent much of its time in the trees.

"We don't know this. But if there were Komodo dragons about you might want 
to be up in the trees with your babies where it's safe. It's something for 
future research, but the fact they had long arms is at least suggestive," 
Professor Stringer told BBC News Online.

Studies of its hands and feet, which have not yet been described, may shed 
light on this question, he added.

H. floresiensis probably evolved from another species called Homo erectus , 
whose remains have been discovered on the Indonesian island of Java.

Homo erectus may have arrived on Flores about one million years ago, 
evolving its tiny physique in the isolation provided by the island.

What is surprising about this is that this species must have made it to 
Flores by boat. Yet building craft for travel on open water is 
traditionally thought to have been beyond the intellectual abilities of 
Homo erectus .

Legendary creatures

Even more intriguing is the fact that Flores' inhabitants have incredibly 
detailed legends about the existence of little people on the island they 
call Ebu Gogo.

The islanders describe Ebu Gogo as being about one metre tall, hairy and 
prone to "murmuring" to each other in some form of language. They were also 
able to repeat what islanders said to them in a parrot-like fashion.

"There have always been myths about small people - Ireland has its 
Leprechauns and Australia has the Yowies. I suppose there's some feeling 
that this is an oral history going back to the survival of these small 
people into recent times," said co-discoverer Peter Brown, an associate 
professor of archaeology at New England.

The last evidence of this human at Liang Bua dates to just before 12,000 
years ago, when a volcanic eruption snuffed out much of Flores' unique 
wildlife.

Yet there are hints H. floresiensis could have lived on much later than 
this. The myths say Ebu Gogo were alive when Dutch explorers arrived a few 
hundred years ago and the very last legend featuring the mythical creatures 
dates to 100 years ago.

But Henry Gee, senior editor at Nature magazine, goes further. He 
speculates that species like H.floresiensis might still exist, somewhere in 
the unexplored tropical forest of Indonesia.

Textbook rewrite

Professor Stringer said the find "rewrites our knowledge of human 
evolution." He added: "To have [this species] present 12,000 years ago is 
frankly astonishing."

Homo floresiensis might have evolved its small size in response to the 
scarcity of resources on the island.

"When creatures get marooned on islands they evolve in new and 
unpredictable courses. Some species grow very big and some species grow 
very small," Dr Gee explained.

The sophistication of stone tools found with the "hobbit" has surprised 
some scientists given the human's small brain size of 380cc (around the 
same size as a chimpanzee).

"The whole idea that you need a particular brain size to do anything 
intelligent is completely blown away by this find," Dr Gee commented.

Because the remains are relatively recent and not fossilised, scientists 
are even hopeful they might yield DNA, which could provide an entirely new 
perspective on the evolution of the human lineage.

Story from BBC NEWS:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/go/pr/fr/-/1/hi/sci/tech/3948165.stm

Published: 2004/10/27 22:15:52 GMT

state to which you may belong, from all that you have held as dear as life 
itself. For this obedience is the law of our being."
   Gandhi

rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."

Message-Id: <6.1.2.0.2.20041027195249.02a14808@localhost>
X-Sender: apollo@localhost
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.1.2.0
Date: Wed, 27 Oct 2004 19:55:13 -0700

Mime-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  WONDER-Full

--=====================_18807754==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit


FRIDAY, October 29th

KeiStar Productions in association with, Massive Selector, Fresco, & 
Fatsouls presents:

WONDER-Full

Even the most devoted contrarian has trouble hating on Stevie Wonder. So 
why not do a party dedicated to the wonder of Stevie ? New York 
DJ-producers Bobbito , a.k.a. Cucumberslice (Fruit Meat Records), and 
Spinna (Beyond Real) have been doing just that with their Stevie Wonder 
appreciation party  Wonder-Full  for five years now, even taking it on 
the road to Amsterdam , London , and Tokyo . On the West Coast for the 
first time, this promises to be a good-time jam full of all soul flavors 
inspired by Wonder, with local support from Sake 1 (Local 1200), Said ( 
Fatsouls ), and the Massive Selector and Fresco crews.

ABOUT DJ SPINNA
Born and raised in Brooklyn, New York, DJ Spinna is regarded as one of the 
most versatile and talented producers / DJ's / remixers in today's musical 
arena. He's produced numerous tracks and remixes for artists such as 
Michael Jackson, De La Soul, George Michael, Mary J. Blige , Mos Def, Shaun 
Escofery , Grand Puba , Zero 7, and Soulive . Those who follow DJ Spinna 
and have witnessed his legendary DJ sets claim that he is one of the most 
important figures in the world of music today.
   <http://massiveselector.com/radio.php?show=spinna>--> Listen to a set

ABOUT BOBBITO
Although Bobbito aka Dj Cucumberslice is a bonafide Hip-Hop legend, any 
reader of his Vibe column would know that his musical passion goes way 
beyond just Rap. As a club DJ, crowds worldwide from Sweden to South Africa 
have celebrated his unique blend of Rare Funk, Latin, Afro-Beat, Soul, 
Classic Rock, House, and Ballads. He's an accomplished music columnist for 
the Vibe Magazine, 
<http://massiveselector.c.topica.com/maacMeDaba0S1a5lYmlcaeQyb9/>wrote the 
most the most talked about book regarding sneaker culture, "Where'd You Get 
Those?" , and even runs his own record label, Fruitmeat . But who can 
forget back in 1990 when he met DJ Stretch Armstrong and started the 
Stretch & Bobbito Show on WKCR 89.9 FM. Voted the "Best Hip Hop Radio Show 
of All Time," Stretch & Bobbito introduced the world to unsigned acts like 
Nas , Jay Z, Big Pun, Wu-Tang, Mobb Deep, and many others that would go on 
to change the face of Hip Hop. Bobbito's list of accolades goes on and on...

Join us for a special evening in celebration of soulful music in all forms 
inspired by the genius of Stevie Wonder. From Funk to Hip-Hop, House to 
Broken Beat, Dancefloor Classics and beyond, DJ SPINNA & BOBBITO are coming 
at you all the way live and direct from the Big Apple to spread love.

Starring
DJ SPINNA
(Beyond Real Productions / WonderWax Music)
BOBBITO aka Cucumber Slice
(VIBE Magazine / Fruit Meat Records)

Featuring
SAKE-ONE (local 1200s)
DJ SAID (fatsouls / atmosphere)

the Massive Selector Crew
PROOF
pantyROBber
MALEX

along with fresco's finest
HAKOBO
KENTO
YOSHITO

PRICE: <http://massiveselector.com/newsletter/presale.htm>$10 presale, $15 
b4 11:30pm, $20 after
TIME: 10pm-4am
MUSIC: Hip-Hop, Soul, House, & Broken Beats
MORE INFO:
<http://www.keistar.com>keistar.com
<http://djspinna.com/>djspinna.com
<http://www.somosarte.com/Bobbito/>bobbito.com




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands 
of the bosses and their employers, the special interests.  An invisible 
empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."
-Woodrow Wilson

"There are times when you have to obey a call which is the highest of all, 
i.e. the voice of conscience even though such obedience may cost many a 
bitter tear, and even more, separation from friends, from family, from the 
state to which you may belong, from all that you have held as dear as life 
itself. For this obedience is the law of our being."
   Gandhi

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_18807754==.ALT--

empire has been set up above the forms of democracy."

i.e. the voice of conscience even though such obedience may cost many a 
bitter tear, and even more, separation from friends, from family, from the 
state to which you may belong, from all that you have held as dear as life 
itself. For this obedience is the law of our being."
   Gandhi

rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."

> Thought this might interest you...

> love, Heidi
>
> Borealis2000 Newsletter <dirkobudzinski@borealis2000.com> wrote:
>
> Borealis2000News
> Total Lunar Eclipse
>
> The second and last lunar eclipse of the year will be well placed for
North Americans. Totality lasts 1 hour 21 minutes while the Moon will glow
in yellow-orange and coppery-red colors. The totally eclipsed Moon will
appear to have a bright rim along its northern edge.
>
>
>
> OBSERVING TIMES
> US and Canada: The Moon enters Earth's shadow at 9:14 pm EST / (6:14 pm
PST), followed by totality during 10:23 - 11:45 pm EST / 7:23 - 8:45 pm PST
and exits Earth's shadow at 00:54 am EST / 9:54 pm PST.
>
> Europe: Eclipse occurs during the early morning hours of Thursday, October
28. The Moon enters Earth's shadow at 01:14 UTC, followed by totality during
02:23 - 03:45 UTC and exits Earth's shadow at 04:54 UTC.
>
>
> Clear skies and enjoy the show!
>
> Dirk Obudzinski
> http://borealis2000.com
>
>
>
>
>
>

Subject: [sfraves] Remix Hotel???

did someone already post this or was everyone sleeping?


Technics presents the Remix Hotel San Francisco

Remix and partners descend on San Francisco for three FREE evenings of 
technology master classes, workshops, seminars and clinics on music 
production and performance for electronic-and urban-music producers, 
engineers, musicians and DJs. The Remix Hotel offers exposure to and 
training on the hottest products available on the production and performance 
markets. Check in and check it out at the W Hotel San Francisco.

Confirmed performances by Telefon Tel Aviv, Matthew Dear, Photek, Boom Bip, 
Richard Devine, Deepsky, Sound Tribe Sector 9, DJ Irene, Sutekh, DJ 
Battlekat, and Kid 606, as well as Q&As with Paul van Dyk, Gabriel & 
Dresden, Hieroglyphics' Domino, Xcel from Blackalcious, Sister SF DJs and DJ 
Colette. Technics is the Remix Hotel presenting sponsor, and other confirmed 
Technology Partners include Apple, Rane, Serato, Pioneer, Blue Sky, 
Digidesign, Cakewalk, Denon, Steinberg, Ableton, Vestax, Korg, Mackie and 
Allen & Heath, with more to be announced.

Daytime events will include special artist appearances and the opportunity 
to attend the 117th AES Convention next door at Moscone. Evening events will 
include bonus parties and the return of the VIP Club Pass available 
exclusively to Remix subscribers. Stay tuned with RHSF events at window 
http://sf.remixhotel.com. Register online today!

buy them separately.(Buy them both, i learned that if you buy one you'll 
crave to hear the rest of it....*Slapping hands*BAD GIRL ME!) Listening to 
that set i literally thought i was there, he really had some great tracks 
there too.

you get in the CD.

----Original Message Follows----
From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: [sfraves] MIX REVIEW: Koroma Live on House Nation
Date: Wed, 27 Oct 2004 12:02:53 -0700

Ok, so Koroma gave me this like 3 months ago (maybe more), and I am just now 
peeping it as I sit here at my lovely new job (which allows me the luxury of 
jamming beats all day long whilst I work).

I have to say, barring a few sloppy mixes - this mix SLAYS. Definitely your 
mama's sleepy ass progressive house. This mix bangs like crazy, has an 
overall excellent track selection/programming and really gets you amped up. 
I am bouncing in my seat as I listen to it, and I'm quite sure my co-workers 
think I'm ADHD or crackhead - somethin' along those lines.

Anyhoo - I don't have a tracklisting, but rest assured, it is dope.

While we're BS'ing about prog.house - go to  www.friskyradio.com  and 
download Jack Triumph's latest mix "Feel". It is 
realllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllly pretty, well executed, and epic. As 
good if not better than those shite Global Underground mixes put out by the 
"pros". (and Jack actually mixes - no digital mixing)

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Substructure//Mario Bros.
DC/MD/VA/CA
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
AIM:  OPKing138

Upcoming dates:
10-29-04 @ SUEDE (San Francisco, CA)

> Technics presents the Remix Hotel San Francisco
>
> Remix and partners descend on San Francisco for three FREE evenings of 
> technology master classes, workshops, seminars and clinics on music 
> production and performance for electronic-and urban-music producers, 
> engineers, musicians and DJs. The Remix Hotel offers exposure to and 
> training on the hottest products available on the production and 
> performance markets. Check in and check it out at the W Hotel San 
> Francisco.
>
> Confirmed performances by Telefon Tel Aviv, Matthew Dear, Photek, Boom 
> Bip, Richard Devine, Deepsky, Sound Tribe Sector 9, DJ Irene, Sutekh, DJ 
> Battlekat, and Kid 606, as well as Q&As with Paul van Dyk, Gabriel & 
> Dresden, Hieroglyphics' Domino, Xcel from Blackalcious, Sister SF DJs and 
> DJ Colette. Technics is the Remix Hotel presenting sponsor, and other 
> confirmed Technology Partners include Apple, Rane, Serato, Pioneer, Blue 
> Sky, Digidesign, Cakewalk, Denon, Steinberg, Ableton, Vestax, Korg, Mackie 
> and Allen & Heath, with more to be announced.
>

> to attend the 117th AES Convention next door at Moscone. Evening events 
> will include bonus parties and the return of the VIP Club Pass available

> I'm totally stoked that so many of you are coming tomorrow nite to
> kvetsch amongst friends and work to become better informed voters.    
> Ever
> since i came to CA, i was horrified at how much one needed to know  to
> vote remotely responsibly on issues.  Already i've spoken with many  of
> you about the challenges of the issues presented to us.  I sooo look
> forward to tomorrow night as an opportunity to become informed amongst
> friends.
>
> If you forget which Propositions you're covering, let me know.  My goal
> is that we're going to run through the issues as fast as possible.    
> With
> 36 measures on the ballot, this means that everyone gets like 2   
> minutes
> to explain the pros/cons of each ballot.  Discussion can/should  occur  
> if
> there are disagreements or more information needed.  Drinking  should
> occur whenever Starchild's name is invoked.  Drinking will  continue to
> occur until Starchild is long since forgotten.  And we  shall have  
> fun!!!!
>
> {{hug}}
>
> danah

	delsp=yes;

http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-=20
libertarian29oct29,1,42922.story

2004 ELECTIONS

It Takes a Strong Constitution to Run as a Libertarian

Michael Badnarik has no chance of winning, but he just might siphon key =20=

votes from Bush.
By Susannah Rosenblatt
Times Staff Writer

October 29, 2004

SALEM, Ore. =97 Michael Badnarik is hardly a household name. But some =20=

analysts are wondering if the Libertarian Party's presidential nominee =20=

=97 almost entirely absent from the national media's consciousness =97 =20=

might be pulling a Ralph Nader on the right.

Could Badnarik, a 50-year-old computer programmer from Austin, Texas, =20=

cost President Bush a key state or two by attracting the votes of some =20=

conservatives, much as Democrats worry about Nader siphoning liberal =20
voters from Sen. John F. Kerry?

At the least, Badnarik's potential appeal to some conservatives is =20
undeniable.

Gun rights? Check. Free trade? Check. Lowering taxes? Badnarik wants to =20=

scrap the Internal Revenue Service. In fact, he would like to abolish =20=

most of the federal government, along with public schools and welfare.

Badnarik got the Libertarian nomination after driving across the nation =20=

and explaining to audiences why he should be president, occasionally =20
running out of cash to keep going.

Helped by an impressive debate performance in May at the nominating =20
convention in Atlanta, Badnarik beat out two better-known opponents, =20
producer Aaron Russo and talk show host Gary Nolan.

"To say I was a dark horse in the campaign is a blatant =20
understatement," Badnarik said recently while traveling to a speech at =20=

Willamette University in Salem, Ore.

Since his nomination, Badnarik has visited 42 states, secured ballot =20
access in 48, raised nearly $1 million, and left some pollsters =20
wondering about his possible effect on the election.

In a race in which a state or two is "decided by a hair," Badnarik =20
"could be the kingmaker," said Larry Jacobs, director of the 2004 =20
Elections Project at the University of Minnesota's Humphrey Institute.

Jacobs said the Libertarian ticket would be fortunate to draw 1% of the =20=

vote nationwide. But "there may be a few battleground states where =20
they're able to reach 1% or even 2% =85 perhaps tilting the [state] in =20=

John Kerry's direction," Jacobs said.

He cited Wisconsin as a possibility.

For his part, Badnarik has zeroed in on New Mexico and Nevada. He has =20=

aired television ads in both =97 $60,000 in New Mexico, about $50,000 in =
=20
Nevada =97 and visited them.

The 33-year-old Libertarian Party espouses fiscal conservatism and a =20
dramatically reduced federal government, coupled with social =20
progressivism, all under the umbrella of personal freedom.

Like any good Libertarian, Badnarik is a fan of the Constitution =97 so =20=

much so that he developed an eight-hour Constitution class that he =20
sometimes taught on the campaign trail to raise cash.

"We have this really crazy idea that the Constitution actually means =20
something," Badnarik said.

He advocates the rapid removal of U.S. troops from Iraq, arguing that =20=

America is "not supposed to be policeman of the world." He disagrees =20
with the Bush administration's doctrine of preemption and would attack =20=

nations harboring terrorists only if presented with clear evidence of a =20=

threat.

He also said that if the passengers aboard the planes that crashed into =20=

the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001, had had guns, the terrorists =20=

"wouldn't have gotten past the beverage cart."

Badnarik favors legalizing drugs and considers a constitutional ban on =20=

gay marriage "bigotry." Abortion is a stickier question among =20
Libertarians, and Badnarik describes the party as split on the issue.

David Robinson, 26, an assistant manager at a Burger King, was among =20
about 40 supporters standing in the spitting rain at a recent Badnarik =20=

rally on the Capitol's steps in Salem.

He said he might have voted Republican were it not for the federal =20
budget deficit that the Bush administration had incurred. "If the =20
Republicans walked their own talk in terms of fiscal responsibility, =20
then I could vote for more Republican candidates. But they don't =20
nationally," Robinson said.

The Bush campaign is not concerned about Badnarik's possible effect on =20=

the president's reelection chances.

"We're focused on the contrast between President Bush and John Kerry," =20=

campaign spokeswoman Tracey Schmitt said.

The Libertarian Party's national numbers are small: Only 600 hold =20
elected office nationwide, and the party garnered about 400,000 votes, =20=

or .36%, in 2000.

Badnarik has struggled to make his voice heard. He was arrested with =20
Green Party presidential hopeful David Cobb three weeks ago trying =20
enter the second presidential debate at Washington University in St. =20
Louis, but the stunt hardly made news.

"Michael has jokingly said we'd have to set ourselves on fire in the =20
middle of the street to get attention," said Badnarik's assistant, Jon =20=

Airheart. "Of course, that only works once."

If you want other stories on this topic, search the Archives at =20
latimes.com/archives .

Article licensing and reprint options



Copyright 2004 Los Angeles Times

--Apple-Mail-10-502805594--

  special performance: The Human Sewing Machine

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Flametal - Saturday Oct. 30th - 8 pm

--Apple-Mail-4-529459447
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=ISO-8859-1;
	format=flowed

My friend Benjamin Woods is performing this Saturday at La Pe=F1a=20
Cultural Center in Berkeley. His show will be a fusion of flamenco,=20
metal, flamenco dancers, and theater, and should be wicked-cool.

Ben is an amazing guitarist, and this show is sure to be something=20
special. He first told me about his idea of combining metal and=20
flamenco about 5 years ago, and it's great to see it finally coming to=20=

fruition.  He's got some mp3's on his web site (www.flametal.com) -=20
have a listen - it's good stuff.

The show Saturday night will be done with plenty of time left for=20
partying afterwards.  UltraGypsy will be opening. ben's BSP is below.

-Philip-



La Ni=F1a Flamenco Series presents Halloween with Flametal!
Special guest UltraGypsy

The bone-chilling premiere of Benjamin Woods' wicked brew, mixing=20
Flamenco & Metal.
Featuring a world-class band of shredders and the evil and seductive=20
Flametal Dancers, La Fani and Melissa Cruz.

=A1Celebre el D=CCa de los Muertos con FLAMETAL!

At La Pe=F1a Cultural Center 3105 Shattuck Ave. Berkeley
8:30pm $15adv. $17dr.

www.flametal.com=

--Apple-Mail-4-529459447--

Subject: [sfraves] wackest Stealth Lynndie yet (NRR/Halloween)

 Tan v-neck T shirt, desert combat pants, boots, and a
cigarette.

mocking?   We could stealth Terry while he's engrossed
in his laptops.
  
who's got tickets and LSD?    I have wine and 16 balls
the light up when you bounce them.  Looking to get rid
of at least 14.

Lynndie yet.  (Sorry, I'm slow getting into this
thing):

in a tree and shot, Bentong, Malaysia"

Subject: [sfraves] Jesus, another Halloween idea

So, watching "Passion of the Keee-RIST!" isn't the
thing to do if you need cheering up or a peaceful
night's sleep.  But is does inspire awesome costume
ideas.

If anyone's good at makeup, you should go as Gibson's
bloody, lacerated Christ.  Man, there's nothing like
watching a guy getting the bejeezus whipped out of him
for 126 minutes.  

To complete the Gibson version, moan and grunt
frequently. Remember, you're only human.

Here's a rad picture to get you started:

http://www.allmoviephoto.com/photo/2003_the_passion_006.html

BOO!-merang

"what are you doing for halloween, ig?"
"i'm waiting for my candy delivery. what are you doing, sweet thing?"
"'im going to spend as much time with a bunch of dorks as i can. hopefully, someone will spend as much time as possible making fun of me, and maybe they might even hurt my feelings and not care."
"sounds interesting."
"maybe you should go, and i should wait for the candy since that is where you are at."
"i guess so, but also, i am actually going through a really wierd growth spurt which makes me really fictional."
"cool. guess we get to live happily ever after just like the story says."
"as soon as the candy is here." :)

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  DIRTY w/ Autobots and Subscience DnB Room

Evil Breaks presents....

DIRTY
featuring The Autobots

The Autobots in their first ever west coast appearance. With a special 
outside DnB room hosted by the Subscience crew with live fire dancers, free 
cd's, vinyl, stickers and more.....


The Autobots (Broke/Skuff/TCR/Passenger/Botchit) - UK

The Autobots are Huddersfield based Tom & Jez.Before the start of the 
Autobots project in 2002, they were both veterans of the dance scene, Tom 
has produced over 40 drum and bass releases since 1992, while Jez has been 
promoting dance events since the late 1980's. And although they are fairly 
new to the breaks scene, they have had releases on almost every major breaks 
label, they've toured all around the world, and their tracks can be found in 
the boxes of a lot of the biggest names in the business. Don't miss them on 
their first ever west coast appearance.

Check out the Nubreaks.com Interview:
http://www.nubreaks.com/?dir=features/tafeat0427&section=autobots_feature

Download their newest mix:
http://www.theautobots.com/autobot%20mix%20july%2004_96k.mp3


Evil Breaks room:

Ripple (Subscience)
B-Smarter (www.Sparxx.us/Equalize Ent/Virus Breaks) - Seattle, WA
Aaron Jae vs Athena (AaronJae.com/Evil Breaks/the Nubotz)
Bam vs Influence (Evil Breaks/in Tha Mix)

Subscience DnB room:

Method One (Method-One.com)
Arson (Urban Drums/www.594Apparel.net)
The Hitmen (Subscience)
Doubleday (Swatchdog Recordings)


Located at Jellys (295 China Basin Wy) this event will be going strong from 
9pm - 3am.

$7 before 11pm and $10 after that.

< Brandon / DJ Bam >

DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
http://www.invibe.com/bam

Saturday, November 6, 2004 ** POP w/ Jeff Samuel (DJ) **


SATURDAY NOVEMBER 6TH 2004 POP at Rx Gallery - Every First Saturday


SPECTRAL RECORD RELEASE PARTY - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -=
=20
- - - -

BROKER/DEALER [LIVE] - SAN FRANCISCO, CA

Equipped with an array of samplers, sequencers and vintage synthesizers,=20
San Francisco wunderkinds Broker/Dealer make catchy minimal electronic=20
music equally suited for the den or the dancefloor. Simultaneously=20
channeling the aquatic dub of Berlin's Chain Reaction label and the=20
genre-defining minimal techno of the Kompakt imprint, on their debut=20
full-length, Initial Public Offering, B/D recalls German electronic=20
artists like Mike Ink, not to mention Metro Area's innovative=20
electro-disco.

After cooling off from last years full-length record on Asphodel,=20
Broker/Dealer comes back with something a bit more for the dance floor on=
=20
their new 12" single on Ghostly's Spectral label. The duo will perform a=20
special live set in honor of the release along with celebrating the=20
Dealer's 30th birthday!


JEFF SAMUEL [DJ] - SEATTLE, WA

Jeff Samuel's foray into electronic music began in 1995 when he first=20
witnessed a DJ set by Detroit's Claude Young in Columbus, Ohio.  He was=20
then introduced to that city's ele_mental collective, an inspiring core of=
=20
artists which included Ohio artists Titonton Duvante, the Archetype and=20
Todd Sines among others.  Through their concept-oriented events which=20
showcased the finer points of electronic music, he became enthralled and=20
began to DJ in 1996.  Soon after, he purchased his first synth and drum=20
machine.

While attending college in 1997, Jeff began exploring the possibilities of=
=20
software-based music production where he saw greater possibilities for=20
creativity and workflow.  He encountered much scrutiny for attempting to=20
make techno using only a computer.  Nevertheless, by 1998 he had started=20
to create his own completed tracks using an early version of Fruityloops=20
(now FL Studio).  Music from his first demo was signed to the German label=
=20
Lo-fi Stereo.  The "Bidooba" single was released in 1999 and featured a=20
remix from Kompakt's Michael Mayer.  Other tracks from the same demo found=
=20
their way to minimal techno pioneer Daniel Bell, who released them on his=
=20
7th City label in 2001.

Jeff pushed into the new millennium continuing his DJ career, releasing=20
more music and completing his college degree in Audio Production=20
simultaneously.  2002 proved to be a significant year which saw his=20
'Digital Self' Tektite EP remixed by Ricardo Villalobos, his abstract=20
material released by UK label Emoticon, and the beginning of a long=20
relationship with Cologne-based Trapez Recordings.  He also left Ohio for=
=20
the western port city of Seattle, where he pursued a career as a Sound=20
Designer in the videogame industry.

Today, Jeff Samuel is a sought-after remixer with a heavy DJ and=20
production schedule who still finds the time to make SFX for videogames.=20
His records are played by a diverse range of the world's most talented=20
DJ's including: Richie Hawtin, Sven Vath, Ricardo Villalobos, Francois K,=
=20
Steve Bug, Akufen, Craig Richards, Mazi, Claude Young, Timo Maas, Josh=20
Wink, Electric Indigo, Michael Mayer and John Tejada.  He is also=20
currently the only American DJ represented by the elusive Kompakt=20
organization.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Rx Gallery 132 Eddy=20
Street @ Mason Street San Francisco, CA 94102 http://www.rxgallery.com/ -=
=20
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - FREE before 10pm - $7=20
after / 9pm-2am / 21+

http://dreamchimney.com/POP/

Friday, November 12, 2004 ** DIRTY w/ The Autobots **

The Autobots in their first ever west coast appearance. With a special=20
outside DnB room hosted by the Subscience crew with live fire dancers,=20
free cd's, vinyl, stickers and more.....

The Autobots (Broke/Skuff/TCR/Passenger/Botchit) - UK

The Autobots are Huddersfield based Tom & Jez.Before the start of the=20
Autobots project in 2002, they were both veterans of the dance scene, Tom=
=20
has produced over 40 drum and bass releases since 1992, while Jez has been=
=20
promoting dance events since the late 1980's. And although they are fairly=
=20
new to the breaks scene, they have had releases on almost every major=20
breaks label, they've toured all around the world, and their tracks can be=
=20
found in the boxes of a lot of the biggest names in the business. Don't=20
miss them on their first ever west coast appearance.

Check out the Nubreaks.com Interview:=20
http://www.nubreaks.com/?dir=3Dfeatures/tafeat0427&section=3Dautobots_featu=
re

San Francisco California, USA

Friday, November 12, 2004 ** Lee Coombs - Breakfast of Champions **

In the history of SF underground parties, there is one party that has=20
become the after party to start all parties.  In the spirit of keeping=20
things fresh, fun and original, the Breakfast of Champions party was born.=
=20
It traditionally starts at 6AM, the first day of the year, with the intent=
=20
on keeping the party going for those that didn't want to stop.  A bus full=
=20
of Space Cowboys collected those filing out of the parties across San=20
Francisco, and brought them to BOC.  After a few New Years passing, the=20
party is proudly maintained by everyone who walks through the doors.

Of course this party would not be mentionable if it wasn't for the DJs=20
that have graced the decks.  Along with all the Space Cowboys DJs, we have=
=20
hosted several local & international superstars who saved their best for=20
last and played amazing sets at 9AM.  One of these DJs is Lee Coombs, from=
=20
the Fingerlickin' UK family.  His uniquely tuned styles of acid tinged,=20
bass driven breakbeats, have been the soundtrack to many a Space Cowboy=20
party.  He joined us in '02 & '04.  He proudly returns to San Francisco to=
=20
promote the 11/16/04 release of his new album entitled 'Breakfast of=20
Champions.'

We need say no more.  We're tickled pink.  And ready to rock.  Please join=
=20
us for a night with new music, old friends, at one of the undeniably best=
=20
sounding clubs in the city.

LEE COOMBS - Breakfast of Champions US Album Release party hosted by the=20
Space Cowboys & 1015 Folsom WITH ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCES BY:  Kid Beyond=20
(live beatboxing), Felix the Dog (Groundscore), Adam Ohana (Get Freaky),=20
Benchun (False Profit) and the Space Cowboy DJ crew: Brad Robinson, The=20
Geometrist, 8ball, Kapt'n Kirk, Mancub, rrrus, & Smoove Visuals by James=20
Green & pixnstones

Friday November 12, 2004 | 10PM - 6AM 1015 Folsom, SF | 21+ w/Id | free b4=
=20
10:30 - $20 after

RSVP at http://www.spacecowboys.org/breakfast/ for free guestlist before=20
midnight, $10 after

http://www.spacecowboys.org/ http://www.1015.com http://leecoombs.com/=20
http://www.fingerlickin.co.uk/ http://kidbeyond.com http://pixnstones.com/=

San Francisco California, USA

Saturday, November 13, 2004 ** Loveworks presents: FUTUREDISCO **

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: Loveworks presents ~Q FUTUREDISCO ~Q ~V 11.13.04

Loveworks, the spark that has grown into an intense seven year inferno=20
combining house music, art, and cutting edge atmospherics continues it~Rs=
=20
series of monthly audiosocial experiments by immersing you in ~Q=20
FUTUREDISCO ~Q on Saturday November 13th ~R04 at their homebase~W the 111=
=20
Minna Gallery in San Francisco~Rs SOMA District.  This special event will=
=20
be homage to the roots of house music; disco in it~Rs past and present=20
forms.  In the early part of the evening, the Classics Caf=E9 will focus on=
=20
classic underground disco and the main floor will feature the sounds of=20
mutant disco, twisted disco and disco house later in the night.=20
Loveworks is proud to announce it~Rs first guest appearance by acclaimed=20
DJ and producer, DJ MFR of TRANSPORT RECORDINGS who will be lending his=20
smooth, pumping house style to the Loveworks dancefloor. Also supporting=20
MFR is Loveworks resident dj MATT VALENZ who will be harnessing the=20
rhythmic power of disco and aiming it straight at the crowd !  At the door=
=20
you will encounter a kindler, gentler guardian named TAMER who will once=20
again be serving up outfit and giving out smiles as well as guest services=
=20
by the newest member of the door team, MATT WALKER.  Your hosts for the=20
evening are NORI CASTILLO and DIANNA JACOBS who were instrumental in the=20
creation of the legendary TOONTOWN parties as well as CAREFREE DANCING,=20
the original house party at 177 Townsend.  Promoboy JIM WILLIAMS will also=
=20
be on hand to help ease you into the groove of the party !  Don~Rt forget=
=20
to join us early as the Classics Caf=E9 presents a very special event with=
=20
MEDIUM RARE MUSIC as they host a customer appreciation party for their=20
loyal patrons.  The Loveworks Classics Caf=E9 is an early evening deep dive=
=20
into the finer aspects of classic house, disco, funk, and soul that truly=
=20
kicks things off properly at 8pm and gets you ready for the serious body=20
rocking that comes later in the night.  This special evening of the Cafe=20
will feature the luscious disco rhythms of the amazing MARCELINO and a=20
special, legendary disco set by MEDIUM RARE~Rs own RON HOFFMAN.

BIO: DJ MFR DJ M.F.R. resides in San Francisco, California, U.S.A. His=20
musical history began at the early age of 18 when he began to djing in=20
Rome.  M.F.R's musical influences range from reggae, hip-hop and soul, to=
=20
classic rock and jazz. In 1990 he connected strongly with the soothing=20
sounds of soulful house music. Soon after, he began DJ'ing to express and=
=20
share his selection of deep, soothing soulful house music with others.=20
Moving to San Francisco in 1995, he immediately started playing in local=20
clubs. In recent years he has begun writing and experimenting with=20
electronic music.  In 1997 Marco together with Miguel "Migs" and Bruno=20
Ybarra started Transport Recordings, an independent label today well=20
established in the underground scene.  Currently he can be found in the=20
studio writing music ranging from deep house vocal songs and dubs, to=20
funky late night disco tracks and smooth down tempo jams A flavor for all=
=20
the dance floors.  In the recent years DJ MFR together with San Francisco=
=20
based producer Vincent Kwok started a production called "NEW MONDO". The=20
first two releases are now out on San Francisco label Eight Fifteen=20
Recordings. He can also be found spinning regularly at all of San=20
Francisco night clubs, such as: BACKFLIP "Mary's Body and Soul",=20
"Gravity", "Wet" 1015 FOLSOM "Release", "Heavy Rotation", RUBY SKYE "DRY",=
=20
"Discover", "Square" , SKYLARK "Sundays" 550 BARNAVALD "Stompy", UP&DOWN=20
CLUB, THE TOP, THE BLIND TIGER "Clique", "Electrolush", THE IRON "Opus",=20
BASE "Here&Now","Pure", THE GALAXY "Fame", "5150", MANHATTAN LOUNGE=20
"Scuba" , 111 Minna "Oxygen", "Atmosphere", DNA lounge "Family Funktion"=20
any many other..  DJ MFR has traveled the world headlining events in=20
cities such as Vancouver, Rome, Florence, LA, Seattle, Miami, Nashville=20
etc.... MFR also just released his hot new mix CD, WEST COAST EXCURSIONS=20
on Transport: http://www.transportrecordings.com/ . Check out a sample of=
=20
his sound online at: http://www.djcode.net/mfr.asp ( click on the MP3 Mix=
=20
button ! )

Loveworks Resident DJ Bio: MATT VALENZ In a world overtaken by automation=
=20
and technology, soul can be a hard thing to come by.  For someone lucky=20
enough to be raised on the sounds of Earth Wind & Fire, Kool and the Gang,=
=20
Diana Ross, and Tower of Power, being soulful comes as second nature. At=20
17 he was turned onto vinyl and was soon playing Miami bass, freestyle,=20
and primitive house at small underground parties in the central California=
=20
area, then moved on to start a career in the music business when he=20
relocated to San Francisco at age 21.  He continued his drive to learn=20
every aspect of the industry, and returned a few years ago from a two year=
=20
stay in England where he was the booking manager for dy-na-mix agency, the=
=20
best agency for underground music in Europe. Now, back in that city, he is=
=20
resident at ~Q Loveworks Dancing ~Q, a mobile house music phenomenon=20
focusing on vibe, music, and art.  past guests such as Doc Martin, Joi=20
Cardwell, J. Sinister, DJ Diz, and international guests like the UK's=20
Eddie Richards, A Man Called Adam, and Terry Francis have also helped to=20
establish the party as a premier place for true house music, funk, soul,=20
and classics in the bay area.  He continues to play at the some of San=20
Francisco's best parties and is currently assembling a personal studio.

Loveworks Resident DJ Bio: DAVID HARNESS In 1990, David began DJ'ing in=20
his hometown of Monterey, California, at the After Dark. As his popularity=
=20
grew past the boundaries of Monterey, he was invited to establish a=20
residency at Tilt, and Sound Factory, in San Francisco. In 1992, as=20
David's popularity continued to grow he, along with DJ, Ruben Mancias and=
=20
promoter Joseph Solis opened a hip and popular club, Lift, at Club Dv8.=20
David joined Bay Area legendary DJ, Pete Avila and host Foxxee Brown on=20
'Your Mama's House', on the Bay Area's popular radio station KMEL FM.=20
Being the only "true" house mix show on any Northern California radio=20
station, DJ's David Harness, Pete Avila and host Foxxee Brown have played=
=20
a key role in furthering House Music in the Bay Area. Also during that=20
year, David established a residency at San Francisco's legendary Club=20
Universe. David Harness has quickly become one of the most well known and=
=20
popular DJ's in the San Francisco Bay Area club scene. David's popularity=
=20
continued to soar, taking him around the world; and the opportunity to=20
play with New York's Legendary DJ's, Frankie Knuckles, Tony Humphries,=20
Little Louie Vega, Tedd Patterson, Dave Morales, London's Ricky Morrison,=
=20
Danny Teneglia, Marques Wyatt- to name a few. He has appeared in articles=
=20
and interviews in Billboard Magazine, Paper Magazine, Surface, XLR8R, Urb,=
=20
Streetsounds, Sweater, HX, Next and the Bay Guardian.

Bio: LOVEWORKS Add a large helping of deep underground house music with a=
=20
side of funk, a heap of disco, and a hint of techno, and you have the most=
=20
nutritious dancefloor experience available in San Francisco. Initially=20
conceived by Dianna Jacobs and Nori Castillo of Toontown / Carefree fame=20
in the summer of '96, Loveworks was envisioned as a refuge from the=20
monotony of local clubs and superficial music, and has become one of the=20
bay area's most well known nights out, while somehow remaining one it's=20
best kept secrets.  It exists to unite people of any race, social status=20
or sexuality together in a comfortable and friendly club environment with=
=20
music as the focal point, and in addition to it's monthly parties at the=20
Minna Gallery, Loveworks also teams up with other like minded parties=20
around the city and has been featured at clubs and parties such as Liquid,=
=20
the Top, Electric, and the Endup.  Besides late night dancing, Loveworks=20
has also been involved in events for Wired Magazine, Apple Computer, Sony=
=20
Digital, Construct Internet Design, and a host of others. Loveworks also=20
had the honor of winning the SF Bay Guardian~Rs ~Q BEST HOUSE CLUB ~Q in=20
1999.

Bio: 111 MINNA GALLERY 111 Minna Gallery is a dynamic ~Qcontemporary art=20
salon~R that provides an arena for multi-dimensional artistic expression=20
in a community atmosphere. The goal of the ~Qgallery-as salon~R concept is=
=20
to nurture and support a communal gathering of artists and a collaboration=
=20
between diverse art forms. This goal is achieved through six-week=20
rotations of visual art exhibitions curated by the staff combined with a=20
variety of music and film events. ~QMinna~R is not only the name of the=20
street on which the gallery is found but also translates from Japanese as=
=20
"everybody," an all-inclusive term that symbolizes the embracing=20
environment of the space. The gallery, which also offers two bars, is=20
crafted in an eclectic, contemporary design with ample furniture inviting=
=20
guests to leisurely relax and enjoy conversation among friends. The=20
combination of art, music, film, dance and conversation found at 111 Minna=
=20
Gallery creates a unique gathering place for a multi-sensory experience.
( contact: Nori for information and guest list questions / 866 841 9139=20
ext 2016 / loveworksdancing@onebox.com.  Check the website at=20
www.loveworksdancing.com )

sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

room was the hallway where where like more Techno,
hardcore, Breakcore, & Bleep Bleep House... LoL

corner of the main room & these 2 huge scary trees in
the middle of the dancefloor & skulls & 2 Huge screens
that showed Yummy visuals all night long above the
DJ... the side room was kinda made up like a forest I
guess... LoL... & just Awesome lighting... upstairs it
was all like big huge screen visuals =3D)  LoL  It was
total eye candy everywhere!

OK.. well.. I could like go on & sound like fluffy &
